duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage attorney calendars, docketing, and scheduling appointments.
Draft legal documents and correspondence, file and organize projects in a fast-paced environment.
Provide litigation support, including developing and maintaining files and reports; drafting/coordinating responses to various legal requirements.
Design, track, and report on subpoena trends and metrics to inform decision-making, measure team performance, and support departmental leadership.
Review and respond to all attorney inquiries for claims in a timely fashion.
Assist with investigating internal and external complaints using appropriate investigative practices and compile relevant documents.
Maintain tracking systems for attorney inquiries and the outcome of investigated cases.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or GED required. Paralegal certificate, or equivalent experience in corporate or private legal practice preferred.
